RegionSpotter Class Reference

#include <RegionSpotter.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

API for spotting a region from an external program.

The RegionSpotter class allows external programs to spot audio into a Pro Tools region. It sends an XML message on Windows, or an AppleEvent on Macintosh.

Currently, the preprocessor definition WIN32 determines whether a Macintosh or Windows RegionSpotter object is created. This can be changed in RegionSpotter.cpp

Compatibility:
  • Macintosh: Pro Tools version 5.1 or later.
  • Windows: Pro Tools version 6.7 or later.

Member Function Documentation

static RegionSpotter* RegionSpotter::CreateRegionSpotter (  const char *  filenameString,
long  regionStartSample,
long  regionStopSample
)  [static]
 

Static function for creating a RegionSpotter object.

Undefined when:
  • regionStartSample or regionStopSample is larger than the number of samples in the source file
  • regionStartSample is larger than regionStopSample
  • file does not exist or cannot be read
Parameters:
filenameString A null-terminated char array of the absolute path to the input audio file
regionStartSample The first sample of the audio file to be included in the region
regionStopSample The last sample of the audio file to be included in the region
Return values:
RegionSpotter* Returns a pointer to a platform specific RegionSpotter object

virtual int RegionSpotter::spot (  short  trackOffset,
long  spotLocationSample,
short  playlistNumber,
const char *  regionNameString
)  [pure virtual]
 

Spots audio in a RegionSpotter object to a Pro Tools region.

NOTE:
  • Currently only spots to one playlist at a time. You must split an interleaved file and call spot() twice to spot a stereo piece of audio.
Undefined when:
  • region name is larger than Pro Tools allows
  • track number does not exist
  • playlist does not exist (e.g. playlist 2 in a mono track)
Parameters:
trackOffset This is the track offset from the current selection.
spotLocationSample This is the sample offset from the start of the current selection.
playlistNumber Playlist to spot region in a multichannel track. Left = 1, Right = 2, etc.
regionNameString Name of the region to spot. Should be a null-terminated char array.
Return values:
int On OS X, Return OSErr value. On Windows, return 0 if successful, -1 if Pro Tools window was not available, -2 if Pro Tools window was available but message was not received. (Could be an old version of PT)
